1.text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father according to flesh has found?

2.text: For if Abraham has been justified on the principle of works, he has whereof to boast: but not before God;

3.text: for what does the scripture say? And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness.

4.text: Now to him that works the reward is not reckoned as of grace, but of debt:

5.text: but to him who does not work, but believes on him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is reckoned as righteousness.

6.text: Even as David also declares the blessedness of the man to whom God reckons righteousness without works:

7.text: Blessed [they] whose lawlessnesses have been forgiven, and whose sins have been covered:

8.text: blessed [the] man to whom [the] Lord shall not at all reckon sin.

9.text: [Does] this blessedness then [rest] on the circumcision, or also on the uncircumcision? For we say that faith has been reckoned to Abraham as righteousness.

10.text: How then has it been reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

11.text: And he received [the] sign of circumcision [as] seal of the righteousness of faith which [he had] being in uncircumcision, that he might be [the] father of all them that believe being in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be reckoned to them also;

12.text: and father of circumcision, not only to those who are of [the] circumcision, but to those also who walk in the steps of the faith, during uncircumcision, of our father Abraham.

13.text: For [it was] not by law that the promise was to Abraham, or to his seed, that he should be heir of [the] world, but by righteousness of faith.

14.text: For if they which [are] of law be heirs, faith is made vain, and the promise made of no effect.

15.text: For law works wrath; but where no law is neither [is there] transgression.

16.text: Therefore [it is] on the principle of faith, that [it might be] according to grace, in order to the promise being sure to all the seed, not to that only which [is] of the law, but to that also which [is] of Abraham’s faith, who is father of us all,

17.text: (according as it is written, I have made thee father of many nations,) before the God whom he believed, who quickens the dead, and calls the things which be not as being;

18.text: who against hope believed in hope to his becoming father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be:

19.text: and not being weak in faith, he considered not his own body already become dead, being about a hundred years old, and the deadening of Sarah’s womb,

20.text: and hesitated not at the promise of God through unbelief; but found strength in faith, giving glory to God;

21.text: and being fully persuaded that what he has promised he is able also to do;

22.text: wherefore also it was reckoned to him as righteousness.

23.text: Now it was not written on his account alone that it was reckoned to him,

24.text: but on ours also, to whom, believing on him who has raised from among [the] dead Jesus our Lord,

25.text: who has been delivered for our offences and has been raised for our justification, it will be reckoned.
